Description: Black-topped red ware segmental bowl with an inverted plain rim and a rounded irregular base; orange-brown fabric, black and burnished on the interior surface and on the exterior just below the rim with greyish patches on the interior, deeply incised crisscross vertical and diagonal lines on the exterior surface below the black rim band, stopping before the base, with a horizontal incised line separating the black rim band and the decorated exterior body surface, slight whitish-grey discolouration of the exterior in parts. Handmade. Complete but with two slight chips on the rim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (F3) Context 20e
Type series: NDRS type BU5.8 (published form type series number)
NDRS type D40.11 (published decoration type series number)
Curator's comments: Associated bag of small sherds from the vessel
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.308, fig. 5.39)
Welsby Sjöström 2001b / Pottery from the Kerma Moyen graves at Site P37 (page 350, fig. 6.3)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1341x (excavation type series number)
Excavation/small finds number: 957e (excavation type series number)
